Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=5 µg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=5 µg/ml), Bacillus thuringiensis (MIC=10 µg/ml), B. subtilis (MIC=10 µg/ml).Fungi:Candida albicans (MIC=20 µg/ml).Antibiotic-resistant pathogens:methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=5-10 µg/ml), penicillin-resistant S. epidermidis (MIC=10 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Antimicrobial peptide that acts by breaking the cell wall. Has antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria. Is efficient in curing staphylococcal skin infection in mice, when externally applied.
Sequence Information.Miscellaneous: Has no activity against Gram-negative bacteria (E.coli and P.aeruginosa).

Literature.Title: Ctriporin, a new anti-methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus peptide from the venom of the scorpion Chaerilus tricostatus.
Literature.Author: Fan Z, Cao L, He Y, Hu J, Di Z, Wu Y, Li W, Cao Z.
